channel.title: Chapter 0: Machine Learning Basics on Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing (DL4NLP)
channel.description: Recent content in Chapter 0: Machine Learning Basics on Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing (DL4NLP)

item.title: Chapter 0.1: ML Basics (I2ML)
item.description: This chapter introduces the basic concepts of Machine Learning. We focus on supervised learning, explain the difference between regression and classification, show how to evaluate and compare Machine Learning models and formalize the concept of learning.

item.title: Chapter 0.2: Supervised Regression (I2ML)
item.description: This chapter treats the supervised regression task in more detail. We will see different loss functions for regression, how a linear regression model can be used from a Machine Learning perspective, and how to extend it with polynomials for greater flexibility.

item.title: Chapter 0.3: Supervised Classification (I2ML)
item.description: This chapter treats the supervised classification task in more detail. We will see examples of binary and multiclass classification and the differences between discriminative and generative approaches. In particular, we will address logistic regression, discriminant analysis and naive Bayes classifiers.

item.title: Chapter 0.4: Multiclass Classification (I2ML)
item.description: This chapter treats the multiclass case of classification. Tasks with more than two classes preclude the application of some techniques studied in the binary scenario and require an adaptation of loss functions.

item.title: Chapter 0.5: Evaluation (I2ML)
item.description: This chapter treats the challenge of evaluating the performance of a model. We will introduce different performance measures for regression and classification tasks, explain the problem of overfitting as well as the difference between training and test error, and, lastly, present a variety of resampling techniques.
